member.name: T:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.FhirFileFormats
member.summary: Provides generic definitions and methods for FHIR file formats supported by the API.

member.name: F:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.FhirFileFormats.XmlFileExtension
member.summary: Default Xml file extension: ".xml"

member.name: F:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.FhirFileFormats.JsonFileExtension
member.summary: Default Json file extension: ".json"

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.FhirFileFormats.HasXmlExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the file extension equals ".xml" (case insensitive).

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.FhirFileFormats.HasJsonExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the file extension equals ".json" (case insensitive).

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.FhirFileFormats.HasXmlOrJsonExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the file extension equals ".xml" or ".json" (case insensitive).

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.FhirFileFormats.HasExtension(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the file extension equals the specified value (case insensitive).

member.summary: Parser configuration settings for the class.

member.summary: Do not raise exceptions for recoverable errors.

member.summary: Allow DSTU2-style Json comment members.

member.name: P:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.FhirJsonParsingSettings.ValidateFhirXhtml
member.summary: Validate narrative against the FHIR Xhtml schema.
member.remarks: Validation of xhtml is expensive, so turned off by default.

member.name: P:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.FhirXmlParsingSettings.AllowedExternalNamespaces
member.summary: A list of namespaces which are allowed in addition to the normal FHIR namespaces.
member.remarks: Normally, the only allowed namespaces are 'http://hl7.org/fhir' and the XHTML namespace.

member.name: T:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.ISeekableEnumerator`1
member.summary: Represents a stream of resources which is both enumerable and enables the user to return to previous positions.

member.name: T:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.INavigatorStream
member.summary: Provides a sequence of instances to efficiently extract information from a raw FHIR resource file, independent of the underlying resource serialization format. Also supports resource bundles.
member.remarks: Implements , but not . Iteration state is tied to the stream instance. Nested enumeration is NOT supported.

member.name: P:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.INavigatorStream.ResourceType
member.summary: The typename of the underlying resource (container).
member.remarks: Call Current.Type to determine the type of the currently enumerated resource.

member.name: P:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.INavigatorStream.IsBundle
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying file represents a Bundle resource, or false otherwise.

member.name: T:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.JsonNavigatorStream
member.summary: Provides efficient extraction of summary information from a raw FHIR JSON resource file, without actually deserializing the full resource. Also supports resource bundles.
member.remarks: Replacement for JsonArtifactScanner (now obsolete).

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.JsonNavigatorStream.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance for the specified serialized json resource file.
member.param: The filepath of a serialized json resource.

member.summary: Create a new instance for the specified serialized json resource file.
member.param: The filepath of a serialized json resource.

member.summary: Create a new instance for the specified serialized json resource file.
member.param: The filepath of a serialized json resource.
Determines if the method should also dispose the internal instance.
Parser settings that control de-serialization behavior.

member.summary: The typename of the underlying resource (container).

member.name: P:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.JsonNavigatorStream.IsBundle
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying file represents a Bundle resource, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.JsonNavigatorStream.Reset
member.summary: Reset the stream to the start position. Requires the internal stream, as specified in the ctor, to support seeking.
member.exception: The internal stream does not support seeking.

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.JsonNavigatorStream.Seek(System.String)
member.summary: Navigate to the artifact with the specified uri.
member.param: The uri of the target artifact.
member.returns: true if found, or false otherwise.
member.exception: The internal stream does not support seeking.

member.name: P:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.JsonNavigatorStream.Position
member.summary: Returns the full resource uri of the current artifact.

member.summary: Returns a new instance for the current entry.

member.name: P:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.JsonNavigatorStream.ParserSettings
member.summary: Gets the configuration settings that control parsing behavior.

member.name: T:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.NavigatorStreamFactory
member.summary: Delegate to create an instance for the specified file path specification.
member.param: The full path to a FHIR resource.
member.returns: An instance, or null if the file format is not recognized.

member.name: T:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.DefaultNavigatorStreamFactory
member.summary:
Factory to create new instances for navigating serialized resources, independent of the underlying resource serialization format.
The internal XML and JSON parsers use the default configuration settings. Alternatively, use to specify custom parser settings.
member.remarks: Supports FHIR resource files with ".xml" and ".json" extensions.

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.DefaultNavigatorStreamFactory.Create(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance to access the contents of a serialized resource stream, independent of the serialization format.
member.param: A for reading a serialized FHIR resource.
A string value that represents the FHIR resource serialization format, as defined by .
member.remarks: Supports XML and JSON serialization formats.
member.exception: The specified FHIR resource serialization format is not supported.

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.DefaultNavigatorStreamFactory.Create(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance to access the contents of a serialized resource stream, independent of the serialization format.
member.param: A for reading a serialized FHIR resource.
A string value that represents the FHIR resource serialization format, as defined by .
Determines if the method should also dispose the specified instance.
member.remarks: Supports XML and JSON serialization formats.
member.exception: The specified FHIR resource serialization format is not supported.

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.DefaultNavigatorStreamFactory.GetSerializationFormat(System.String)
member.summary: Determines serialization format by inspecting the file extension.
member.param: File path to a FHIR artifact.
member.returns: A constant string value as defined by , or null.

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.DefaultNavigatorStreamFactory.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance to access the contents of a serialized resource, independent of the underlying resource serialization format.
member.param: File path specification of a FHIR resource file.
member.returns: A new instance, or null (unsupported file extension).
member.remarks: Supports FHIR resource files with ".xml" and ".json" extensions.

member.name: F:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.DefaultNavigatorStreamFactory.FactoryDelegate
member.summary: delegate for the method.

member.summary: Creates a new instance to access the contents of a serialized resource, independent of the underlying resource serialization format.
member.param: File path specification of a FHIR resource file.
Determines if the method should also dispose the internal instance.
member.returns: A new instance, or null (unsupported file extension).
member.remarks: Supports FHIR resource files with ".xml" and ".json" extensions.

member.name: T:Hl7.Fhir.Serialization.ConfigurableNavigatorStreamFactory
member.summary:
Factory to create new instances for navigating serialized resources, independent of the underlying resource serialization format.
The internal XML and JSON parsers use the specified configuration settings. Alternatively, use the to use default parser configuration settings.
member.remarks: Supports FHIR resource files with ".xml" and ".json" extensions.

member.summary: Create a new instance for the default parser settings.

member.summary: Determines serialization format by inspecting the file extension.
member.param: File path to a FHIR artifact.
member.returns: A constant string value as defined by , or null.

member.param: Configuration settings that control the behavior of the internal XML parser.
Configuration settings that control the behavior of the internal JSON parser.

member.summary:
Gets or sets a boolean value that controls behavior of the methods when encountering an unsupported file/serialization format.
If true, throw a , otherwise (false) return null.

member.name: M:Hl7.Fhir.Utility.SerializationUtil.SanitizeXml(System.String)
member.summary: Replace all the XML specific special characters with the XHTML equivalents
member.remarks: this is based on own research plus combining with results shown here: http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/298519/Fast-Token-Replacement-in-Csharp The RegEx approach does not require multiple passes or string creations while replacing all the items. It occurs in O(n) StringBuilder concatenations + O(n) dictionary lookups
